page.title: 16INTERVIEW OF CAERWYS MAYOR 2
page.content: Far less Welsh is spoken now,he could not speak English when he started School and only Welsh was spoken in most homes. His first memories of Caerwys are of the old fairs held in the street where sheep,cattle and pigs were penned. Horses were trotted up and down the street whilst inspected for any signs of lameness. This came to an end about 1920. He loved bathing in the pool below what is now the fisheries .He looked forward to his 12th birthday when he could join the institute to play tennis.He cannot understand why the youth of today do not make more use of the tennis courts which are freely available.
